text: John Legend has made history as the youngest person ever to achieve that sweet, sweet coveted EGOT status. That's someone who has received the big four, the holy grail of performance accolades : Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, and Tony Awards. Legend, 39, completed the acronym at the Creative Arts Emmy Awards in Los Angeles on Sunday, as did Andrew Lloyd Webber and Tim Rice, all for producing best variety special winner Jesus Christ Superstar Live in Concert. He's also the first black man to land EGOT status, making history in more ways than one.
